ticket.title: Job unit sandbox hardening: NoNewPrivileges, PrivateTmp, Protect*, Restrict*, safe defaults without breaking builds

in_scope: Add systemd hardening directives to job units (prefer system-mode backend):
Make hardening policy-driven (FacPolicyV1), with a known-good default profile.
Emit unit hardening settings into receipts for audit (hash or normalized list).
Stabilize FAC GC bounded-runner coverage for test_gc_plan_skips_running_lanes by using deterministic lane fixtures and lane-dir path checks (not substring matches affected by lane-scoped TMPDIR).
Harden GC lane target planning to accept only known lane inventory entries, ignoring unknown lane_id status records.

steps: Define hardening profile knobs in policy.
Refactor GC lane target selection tests to use deterministic lane status fixtures and bounded-safe assertions.
Constrain idle-lane target collection to known lane IDs and validate with explicit unknown-lane tests.
Run gates suite and iteratively tighten without breaking.

criteria: Default hardening reduces attack surface measurably (documented directives) while preserving successful gates execution.
FAC bounded test runner no longer flakes/fails on test_gc_plan_skips_running_lanes.
GC planner ignores unknown lane IDs when generating lane target/log prune candidates.
